body:
@berendt thanks a lot - i'll have a look asap.
@icewind1991 @mtgap can i ask you to have a look here as well? thx
code looks good besides noted points, i don't have experience with the s3 stuff though.

there are some style issues: http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/app/general/codingguidelines.html

don't split up the copy and rename into file and folder methods, just keep it in one method.

@mtgap: so i'll remove the additonal methods and add the code to the corresponding methods.

@icewind1991: thank's for the review.
i'll now have a look at the style guide and will fix the style issues afterwards.

@berendt i just executed the storage unit test suite on your implementation and following tests require some more attention:

- testroot
- testdirectories
- teststat
- testsearch
- testsearchinsubfolder

please find my phpunit test console log below.

thanks a lot!

@berendt in order to make teardown() work properly you have to change $id to $this->id in https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/apps/files_external/tests/amazons3.php#l31 and https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/apps/files_external/tests/amazons3.php#l36

thx
@berendt any news on this? feel free to get in touch in case you need support! thx
mtime changes are not propagated up to the root but to the parent folder. this is how posix filesystems behave.
@deepdiver1975 ok. i'll add this.
awesome!

sure. feel free.та

unit test is failing - any idea why? thx

@deepdiver1975 i'm moving to the newest aws sdk at the moment. at the moment it's working much better than the old one. i'll close this pull request when i'm finished and will open a new one to have a clean base. the new pull request should be available this afternoon or tomorrow morning.
